qas.question: When was the George Warren Brown School of Social Work founded?
By what other names is the George Warren Brown School of Social Work known?
What degree programs are offered by the George Warren Brown School of Social Work?

answers.text: Master of Social Work (MSW), a Master of Public Health (MPH), a PhD in Social Work, and a PhD in Public Health Sciences

qas.question: What roles was George Warren Brown known?

answers.text: St. Louis philanthropist and co-founder of the Brown Shoe Company

qas.question: What facilities house the  George Warren Brown School of Social Work?
In what year was the  Association of Schools and Programs of Public Health established?
In what year did Brown start offering a Master of Social Work?
In what year did George Warren Brown die?
In what year was Goldfarb Hall built?

context: With roots dating back to <b7_0>1909<b7_0/> in the university's School of Social Economy, the George Warren Brown School of Social Work (commonly called the <a1_0>Brown School or Brown<a1_0/>) was founded in <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0><b8_0>1925<b8_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>. Brown's academic degree offerings include a <a2_0>Master of Social Work (MSW), a Master of Public Health (MPH), a PhD in Social Work, and a PhD in Public Health Sciences<a2_0/>. It is currently ranked first among Master of Social Work programs in the United States. The school was endowed by Bettie Bofinger Brown and named for her husband, George Warren Brown, a <a3_0>St. Louis philanthropist and co-founder of the Brown Shoe Company<a3_0/>. The school was the first in the country to have a building for the purpose of social work education, and it is also a founding member of the Association of Schools and Programs of Public Health. The school is housed within <a4_0>Brown and Goldfarb Halls<a4_0/>, but a third building expansion is currently in progress and slated to be completed in summer 2015. The new building, adjacent to Brown and Goldfarb Halls, targets LEED Gold certification and will add approximately <b9_0>105,000 square feet<b9_0/>, more than doubling the school's teaching, research, and program space.
